articles.author: Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: In the final days leading to his ouster, Syrian President Bashar al-Assad complained to Iran's foreign minister that Turkey was actively supporting Sunni rebels in their offensive to topple him, two Iranian officials told Reuters this week.
articles.title: Before his ouster, Syria's Assad told Iran that Turkey was aiding rebels to unseat him

articles.author: Tuvan Gumrukcu, Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russia is pulling back its military from the front lines in northern Syria and from posts in the Alawite Mountains but is not leaving its two main bases in the country after the fall of President Bashar al-Assad, four Syrian officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia pulling back but not out of Syria, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hezbollah head Naim Qassem said on Saturday that the Lebanese armed group had lost its supply route through Syria, in his first comments since the toppling of President Bashar al-Assad nearly a week ago by a sweeping rebel offensive.
articles.title: Hezbollah chief says group lost its supply route through Syria

articles.author: Josh Smith, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: A defiant South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol faces a second impeachment vote on Saturday over his short-lived attempt to impose martial law, a move that shocked the country, split his party and imperilled his presidency half way through his term.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon faces second impeachment vote over martial law bid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 18 Palestinians were killed in Israeli airstrikes in Gaza on Saturday, medics said, while the Israeli military said it targeted gunmen operating from shelters and aid storages.
articles.title: At least 18 killed in Israeli Gaza strikes, Palestinian medics say

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Georgian lawmakers elected Mikheil Kavelashvili, a hardline critic of the West, as the country’s new president on Saturday, setting him up to replace a pro-Western incumbent amid major protests against the government over a halt to the country’s European Union accession talks last month.
articles.title: Lawmakers in Georgia elect hardline critic of West as new president

articles.author: Hatem Maher
articles.description: Syria's de facto leader, Ahmad al-Sharaa said on Saturday Israel is using false pretexts to justify its attacks on Syria, but that he is not interested in engaging in new conflicts as the country focuses on rebuilding following the end of Bashar al-Assad's reign.
articles.title: Syria's de facto leader not interested in new conflicts despite Israeli attacks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two security agents and two migrants were killed in a shooting in Loon-Plage near the northern city of Dunkirk, French media reported on Saturday, citing security sources.
articles.title: Four killed in a shooting in northern France, suspect claims fifth victim

articles.author: Ricardo Brito, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Harley Sandoval, an evangelical pastor, real estate agent and mining entrepreneur, was arrested in July 2023 for illegally exporting 294 kilos of gold from Brazil's Amazon to the United States, Dubai and Italy.
articles.title: Forensic technology aids Brazil's crackdown on illicit Amazon gold trade

articles.author: Olena Harmash
articles.description: Ukraine's military leadership has replaced the commander overseeing defences in the eastern Donetsk region where Russian forces are making swift advances, a military official said on Saturday.
articles.title: Ukraine replaces commander as Russia advances fast in the east
